item.title: A simple way to model rankings with Stan
item.description: The initial problem I wrote what I thought it was the generative process for some modeling work, and it looked too common to not have a name, so I started to ask around in Twitter: Prob q: Is there a name for a categorical distribution that whenever you get an outcome you remove it from the set? Ex. 1st draw: y ~ cat(p1,p2,p3,p4) ; y = 2 2nd draw y ~ cat(p1/k,p3/k,p4/k) (k = p1+p3+p4); y =1

item.title: Publications & Presentations
item.description: Book in preparation Nicenboim, B., D. Schad, and S. Vasishth An Introduction to Bayesian Data Analysis for Cognitive Science. [read] Unpublished manuscripts [bibtex] Vasishth, S., H. Yadav, D. Schad, and B. Nicenboim (2021). “Sample size determination for Bayesian hierarchical models commonly used in psycholinguistics”. DOI: 10.31234/osf.io/u8yvc. [read] Vasishth, S., B. Nicenboim, N. Chopin, and R. Ryder “Bayesian hierarchical finite mixture models of reading times: A case study”.
